report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: The ASEC analysis team has discovered a continuous distribution of malware disguised as a Windows Help File (*.chm). The most recent CHM file is identical to the file introduced in <APT Attack Being Distributed as Windows Help File (*.chm)> to download the additional malware.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: It appears that the CHM file of this type is distributed in the form of a compressed file. The confirmed filenames of the compressed files and internal CHM files are as follows:

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Names of Compressed FilesNames of Internal CHM FilesMissing Coins Info.ziplost.chmData.zipDefault.chmWage Statement.rarsalary.chmTable 1. Confirmed Filenames

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Missing Coins Info.zip file contains the following additional compressed file and Word file.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Figure 1. Files inside Missing Coins Info.zip

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: The Word file is an innocuous file that contains text related to missing coins (see Figure below).

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Figure 2. Word file

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Find Missing Coins.rar contains lost.chm, and when it is run, it creates Help with content related to coins and performs malicious activities.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Figure 3. Inside Find Missing Coins.rar

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Figure 4. Executed lost.chm

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Inside the lost.chm file is the same HTML file and the internal special command introduced in the previous blog post. As such, running the CHM file results in the execution of the cmd command and the creation of Document.dat and Document.jse in the %USERPROFILE%\Links\ folder. The difference from the previous is that Document.jse is created instead of Document.vbs.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: The data that exists in Document.dat is base64-decoded and saved as Document.jse. The decoded JSE data then uses powershell to download the additional file from a certain URL and runs it (see below).

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: Afterward, it adds %USERPROFILE%\Links\Document.jse to HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run to ensure that the JSE file can be continuously run.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: The following CHM files were found subsequently.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)

chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: This file is compressed with an innocuous PDF file, in a similar fashion to the aforementioned Missing Coins Info.zip.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: The team could not find extra files because the access to the download URL is currently blocked, but users must stay vigilant as the attack may upload various malicious files in the future.

report_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
chapter_title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)
text: AhnLabs anti-malware product, V3, detects and blocks the malware using the alias below.
